title: Market Basket stores in Mass. close early Monday due to the blizzard
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Market Basket closed all Massachusetts stores early on Monday due to severe weather conditions.
The early closure affected over 50 stores in Massachusetts, with some locations also shuttered in New Hampshire and Rhode Island.
More than a dozen Market Basket stores remained open in Maine and New Hampshire amidst the blizzard.

title: Share your blizzard photos with Boston.com
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Boston.com seeks blizzard photos from residents as a nor'easter impacts the Northeast with heavy snow and strong winds.
Massachusetts communities are experiencing double-digit snowfalls, causing challenging conditions with reduced visibility and ongoing accumulation.
Residents are encouraged to send blizzard photos to Boston.com for potential feature in an upcoming article.

title: Did you have to go into work during the blizzard?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Southern New England faces a blizzard with up to 20 inches of snow forecast, prompting state of emergency declaration.
Gov. Maura Healey urged non-emergency workers to work remotely, but some employers still require office attendance.
Some companies offer hotel accommodations for employees, while others creatively avoid going to work during the storm.

title: Mass. plow driver survives near-impalement when tree limb crashes through truck windshield
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: A tree limb crashed through a Kingston plow truck windshield during a blizzard, narrowly missing the driver.
Kingston Police urged residents to avoid roads due to dangerous conditions with high winds and heavy snowfall.
Massachusetts storm caused power outages, travel disruptions, and predicted 18-24 inches of snow in the region.

title: Citing ‘hate’ and child exploitation, AG Campbell logs off X
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Attorney General Andrea Campbell stops using X, citing hate and child exploitation on the platform.
Campbell criticized X's lack of accountability, highlighting its failure to control harmful AI tools like Grok.
Campbell shifts to alternatives Bluesky and Threads, continuing her social media presence amid a Massachusetts AG reelection campaign.

title: Pregnant woman hospitalized after ICE detention in Burlington
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Pregnant woman Djeniffer Benvinda Ribeiro Semedo hospitalized after condition worsened in Burlington ICE detention.
Ribeiro Semedo's lawyer filed a habeas petition challenging legality of her detention; she was subsequently released.
Doctors cited her detention as increasing risk of preterm labor; ICE defended healthcare provided during detention.

title: Amtrak service between Boston and New York suspended due to nor’easter
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Amtrak suspended service between Boston and New York due to a nor'easter, affecting travel until at least 4 p.m. Monday.
Gov. Maura Healey declared a state of emergency; the storm expected to bring 18-24 inches of snow and strong winds.
Nearly 1,000 flights at Logan Airport were cancelled Monday morning because of the blizzard conditions in the region.

title: ‘He said that?’: Joe Mazzulla’s reaction to Pat Riley’s Boston trash talk
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Pat Riley delivered fiery remarks against Boston at a Lakers statue dedication, intensifying the Celtics-Lakers rivalry.
Celtics head coach Joe Mazzulla welcomed Riley's trash talk, expressing excitement after hearing about his comments.
The Celtics defeated the Lakers 111-89, despite Riley's motivational attempts for the Lakers.

title: Town-by-town snow totals: Here’s what’s fallen so far in Mass.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Swansea recorded the highest snow total in Massachusetts, reaching 26.5 inches as of 10:42 a.m. Monday.
Predictions indicate 18-24 inches of snow across Massachusetts with heavy impact in southeastern areas by mid-Monday.
Severe weather may cause power outages due to heavy snow and high winds affecting trees and power lines.

title: Jim Cantore experienced thundersnow live on air in Plymouth Monday morning, and freaked out
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Jim Cantore experienced thundersnow live on air in Plymouth Monday morning, expressing excitement during the broadcast.
This was not Cantore's first on-air thundersnow; he witnessed a similar event in Plymouth during 2015.
Locals noted Cantore's presence in town, often a sign of severe weather, ahead of the storm prediction.
